snippet: Deutsche Telekom of Germany said pretax income fell 31 percent, while French operator Orange reported an 8.5 percent fall, as the sector grapples with a new round of consolidation.
abstract: Deutsche Telekom reports that quarterly pretax income fell 31 percent, to 3.25 billion, or about $4.46 billion, from year-earlier period; cites costs associated with purchase of MetroPCS; French telecom company Orange reports 8.5 percent fall in fourth-quarter pretax profits, to 2.9 billion euros, citing competition from low-cost rivals.
lead_paragraph: Deutsche Telekom of Germany said pretax income fell 31 percent, while French operator Orange reported an 8.5 percent fall, as the sector grapples with a new round of consolidation.

headline.main: Deutsche Telekom and Orange Post Weaker Quarterly Pretax Earnings
headline.print_headline: Deutsche Telekom and Orange Post Declines in Pretax Profits
